reviews.title: Very good value - all inclusive
reviews.text: We booked 3* Allocated on Arrival 7 nights with My Travel flying from Newcastle. Pleasantly surprised to be sent to El Cortijo Blanco, San Pedro - a couple of bus stops up main road from Puerto Banus. No airconditioning and can be very busy at weekends due to influx of Spaniards but our week overall was very enjoyable. Good location, approx 5 mins walk down the side road to lovely promenade and grey sand beach and bus stop yards away to take us to Puerto Banus, Marbella. We're veggies but self-service food was fine (lovely salads), bar open from 1000 until midnight! The entertainment team work hard too - several professional shows laid on during our week of a good standard. 3 pools to choose from, one much quieter than the other 2. San Pedro a short walk up the road is worth a visit too. This Pretty hotel has well maintained gardens etc and the rooms were cleaned daily. Pueblo style with blocks of ground floor and first floor rooms. Ideally suited for all including wheelchair users, families with children.

reviews.title: A good value hotel if you want a cheap holiday!
reviews.text: This may be a long review but you will be glad you read it - don't be put off by some of the other reviews! I've been meaning to write this for the last month or so. The only reason I'm writing now is because I'm looking to go back and thought I'd checkout the reviews.
Me (33) and my mum (50ish!) stayed at the beginning of October for a week. My mum had been before with a group of girls in Jan and recommended it for a cheap hols.
reviews.title: Flies and sickness
Costa Butlins
reviews.text: We went with First Choice but to be honest, my next booking will be to book flights and accomm myself and get a taxi. Although a little expensive, worth the money as you get to your holiday destination an hour earlier...instead of sitting on a coach stopping and starting along some horrible areas of the costa del sol!

When we first got there we were given our key and a little map on how to find our room. We found our room (which was disappointing because we were overlooking the entertainment and bar area). However, I decided that this couldn't be a superior room which we had paid only an extra £20 or so for) and went to reception the following morning. The manageress (English) was very apologetic and said we had been put in the wrong room. She gave us the key for the correct room and we went back to pack and head to our new room.....what a difference for only a little more expense! PLEASE READ....MAKE SURE YOU ASK FOR A SUPERIOR ROOM OVERLOOKING THE GARDENS AT THE BACK. THEY HAVE AIR CONDITIONING AND ARE IN A MUCH NICER PART OF THE HOTEL (AND A LOT QUIETER!)...what a relief!! We could now enjoy the rest of our holiday!!!
reviews.title: excellent value for money should be a 4*
Good Family Clean Hotel
reviews.text: The food was okay - not brilliant but for all inclusive it was okay. The drinks at each of the two bars were fantastic value. You could basically have anything you wanted....and nothing is measured! In fact we had to tell the bar staff to stop pouting as they were triple measures!

Having read some rather negative reviews after booking our holiday we were very pleasantly surprised. We'd decided to go for some winter sunshine and invited another couple of friends to join us. Arriving rather late our first impression was one of amazement as the ever helpful Anita in reception told us leave all our luggage and go straight to the restaurant as it was about to close, we all expected a plate of picked over chips and not much else but were staggered to find a selection which only included chips if you wanted. That set the tone for the rest of our week.The food is not Michelin star quality, but it's varied tasty and plentiful. I did not eat a single chip all week and felt all the better for it.
reviews.title: A real tonic!

reviews.text: The rooms were spotlessly clean and a very high standard of cleaning was maintained all week. The staff were cheerful and friendly and the entertainment was an absolute hoot!

reviews.text: I was very reluctant to go along to the evening Bingo session and had to have a fortifying G&T before my first trip, but it was something I don't think any of our party willever forget. The ladies laughed until they cried and several of the calls will be etched in our memories forever.

There were lots of activities provided each day although we used the hotel as a base for exploring the area so didn't take part in any.Anita heard us talking about a visit to a market and instantly produced a list of all the local markets and bus timetables to get us there and back.
